material.mattext: For money to function as a medium of exchange it must be:

material.mattext: An individual walks to a local sandwich shop and uses a $10 bill to pay for a $6 sandwich, receiving $4 as change for this transaction. This illustrates that as a medium of exchange this $10 bill is:

qtimetadatafield.fieldentry: Explain the types, characteristics and functions of money

material.mattext: An individual walks to a local sandwich shop and uses a $10 bill to pay for a $6 sandwich, receiving $4 as change for this transaction. This illustrates that the $6 sandwich as a measure of value:

qtimetadatafield.fieldentry: Explain the types, characteristics and functions of money

material.mattext: A neighbor has apple trees to harvest but no time to do it. The Peterson family has time to harvest and would like apples. They work out an agreement where the Peterson family helps with the harvest and receives five boxes of apples for every 10 boxes they pick. The kind of a system they are using is ________ system.

qtimetadatafield.fieldentry: Explain the types, characteristics and functions of money

material.mattext: used as a medium of exchange

qtimetadatafield.fieldentry: Explain the types, characteristics and functions of money

material.mattext: What government entity is responsible for the U.S. monetary system?

qtimetadatafield.fieldentry: Explain the types, characteristics and functions of money

material.mattext: In order to know the amount of money in the system, the federal government uses measures to track the U.S. money supply. These measures include:
the most liquid forms of money (cash, checking accounts)
the near cash-items in short-term investments (savings, time deposits below $100,000)
the most long term investments (stocks, bonds)

qtimetadatafield.fieldentry: Describe the purpose of the Federal Reserve System and its role in controlling the money supply and influencing interest rates

material.mattext: The Federal Reserve relies on what other tool(s) to conduct monetary policy besides the discount rate?

qtimetadatafield.fieldentry: Describe the purpose of the Federal Reserve System and its role in controlling the money supply and influencing interest rates

material.mattext: The Federal Reserve uses a variety of monetary policy tools to achieve which of the following goal(s)?

qtimetadatafield.fieldentry: Describe the purpose of the Federal Reserve System and its role in controlling the money supply and influencing interest rates

material.mattext: The Federal Reserve raises the reserve requirement from 7 percent to 8 percent. Consequently banks must set aside more money and have less money to lend, so they raise interest rates. These conditions make it harder and more expensive for people and businesses to borrow money. Because they can’t borrow as much, they can’t spend as much. If people aren’t spending as much, prices don’t go up. With this actions, the Fed has lessened the likelihood of ________.

qtimetadatafield.fieldentry: Describe the purpose of the Federal Reserve System and its role in controlling the money supply and influencing interest rates

material.mattext: The Federal Reserve lowers the reserve requirement from 7 percent to 6 percent. Consequently banks must set aside less money to meet the reserve requirement. They have more money to lend out, and so they lower their interest rates. These conditions make it easier and less expensive for people and businesses to borrow money. Because they can borrow more, they can spend more. If people are spending more, prices go up. With this action, the Fed has lessened the likelihood of ________.

qtimetadatafield.fieldentry: Describe the purpose of the Federal Reserve System and its role in controlling the money supply and influencing interest rates

material.mattext: Hometown Bank has lent borrowers a considerable amount of money in the past 12 months. The Federal Reserve reviews Hometown Bank’s books and sees the bank is now below the required reserve amount. The Federal Reserve requires Hometown Bank to borrow the amount necessary to bring its reserves up to the required level. A member bank, City Bank, has excess reserves which Hometown Bank borrows. The rate for this kind of borrowing is the ________.

qtimetadatafield.fieldentry: Describe the purpose of the Federal Reserve System and its role in controlling the money supply and influencing interest rates

material.mattext: The Fed sees that the economy has a shortage of access to money for lending, borrowing and investment. It wants to increase the amount of money in the system. The Federal Reserve uses its open market policy and takes action to ________ bonds. This increases the reserves of the banks and consequently the banks will begin to loan out more money.

qtimetadatafield.fieldentry: Distinguish the differences between the types of financial institutions including banks, credit unions, finance companies, securities markets

material.mattext: Sheila has $10,000 she wants to invest in individual company stocks she picked out after doing extensive research. What type of financial institution would best suit her needs?

qtimetadatafield.fieldentry: Distinguish the differences between the types of financial institutions including banks, credit unions, finance companies, securities markets

material.mattext: Rupert lives in the small town of Berwyn, PA and his bank is NOVA Bank. In September he had $200,000 in his bank account. One day at the end of October, Rupert went to withdraw $200 from the bank's ATM and discovered that the Pennsylvania Department of Banking and Securities had closed NOVA Bank. The FDIC took over and could not find an institution to take over the failed bank. What will happen next?
The FDIC has insured Rupert’s $200,000 and will send him a check for the full amount.
The FDIC will not honor Rupert’s $200,000 because it is over the insurable limit.
The Pennsylvania Department of Banking and Securities has insured Rupert’s money and will send him a check for the full amount.

qtimetadatafield.fieldentry: Explain how technology is affecting the traditional monetary system and the definition of "money"

material.mattext: One technology gaining popularity is the mobile payment. It is sometimes known as tap-and-go or near field communications (NFC). This technology is:
a method of wireless data transfer
detects and then enables technology in close proximity to communicate
requires an extended amount of time before the process has finished

material.mattext: Issues that digital money raises include:
the IRS has done little to address the tax implications of virtual money
current monetary laws do not include the regulation of digital money
suspicious and illegal transactions cannot be tracked by traditional financial institutions

diverse investments with minimal transaction costs

material.mattext: Investing comes at a cost. The main costs are:
the risk you take—the risk that you won’t get it all back
the opportunity cost of using the cash and forgoing all uses of that cash until it is returned

the percentage of return created for each unit (dollar) of original value
only exists for investments that pay dividends
